title: Where was World On Fire filmed? All the locations from BBC One’s newest drama
text:
World On Fire is set across the continent – but not filmed where you might think (Picture: BBC)

BBC One has yet another Sunday night hit on its hands with their new drama World On Fire.

The World War II drama took over the Sunday night drama slot last weekend where Peaky Blinders left off – and is already proving popular, marking Game Of Thrones star Sean Bean’s return to the small screen.

And while the show’s certainly got us gripped with its story of ordinary people across Europe caught in the crossfire of the Second World War, it boasts some pretty impressive backdrops too.

Just where was the series filmed? Here’s what you need to know…

Where was World On Fire filmed?

World On Fire features a whole plethora of storylines across a string of countries, including Poland, France, Great Britain and Germany.

The action was shot in Manchester and Prague which doubled for Paris, Berlin and Warsaw (Picture: BBC)

But that doesn’t mean it was filmed in all those places – with most of the action being shot in Manchester, and in the Czech Republic’s capital city Prague.

In fact the city stood in for most of the continental action, doubling for Warsaw, Berlin and Paris – although parts of the Polish capital were also recreated in Manchester, with scenes being shot around the Castlefield area.

A lot of the action was also filmed in Manchester, which also doubled for the Polish capital (Picture: BBC)

Speaking of their Prague shoot, executive producer Helen Ziegler told the Radio Times: ‘We found this amazing location just outside the site, this devastated factory.

‘It looked like it had been bombed [it had actually been half-demolished] and it had this eerie beauty to it.’

The drama follows the effect of the Second World War on the lives of ordinary people (Picture: BBC)

Meanwhile director Adam Smith added: Prague was amazing to work in, with some fantastic locations. We built a big set of Warsaw. We tried to get as much real location as we could, then add CGI [computer-generated imagery] on top.’

‘We also pretended parts of Manchester were Warsaw. ‘And parts of Wigan were Paris. It was a really confusing shoot!’

Watch out for the beach in episode five (Picture: BBC)

Things might just get even more confusing later on in the series as Dunkirk enters the fray – with those scenes actually being shot in Blackpool, specifically, on St Anne’s Beach.

You’ll get to see those scenes in episode five.

Who is in the cast of World On Fire?

Sean Bean appears in the series as pacifist Douglas Bennett, who faces a challenging time after both his son and daughter are sent to fight in the war.

Oscar-winning actress Helen Hunt is also in the cast as journalist Nancy Campbell, while other cast members include Blake Harrison, Lesley Manville, Jonah Hauer-King, Julia Brown, Yrsa Daley-Ward and Kasia Tomaszeski

World On Fire continues on BBC One on Sunday night at 9pm.
